channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The H-1B Visa: Why Is Trump Adding a $100,000 Fee?
item.description: President Trump signed a proclamation on Friday adding a $100,000 fee to visas for skilled foreign workers. Immigration hard-liners have criticized th...

item.title: Tropical Storm Gabrielle expected to become 2nd Atlantic hurricane of the season
item.description: Gabrielle is forecast to pass east of Bermuda, the U.S. mainland, and could rise to the strength of a Category 2 hurricane.

item.title: One Dead in Shooting at New Hampshire Country Club
item.description: A suspect was detained after the shooting at the Sky Meadow Country Club in Nashua left one person dead and several others injured, the police said.

item.title: Nepal Uprising Is Latest Challenge to India’s Backyard Diplomacy
item.description: The overthrow of Nepal’s government is the latest in a series of uprisings among India’s neighbors, creating a political churn that complicates its ti...

item.title: Trump Demands That Bondi Move ‘Now’ to Prosecute Foes
item.description: His demand came a day after he ousted the federal prosecutor who failed to charge two of his most-reviled adversaries, Letitia James and James B. Come...

item.title: Man arrested after drive-by shooting at ABC TV station in Sacramento
item.description: At least three bullets were fired into the station, according to the Sacramento Police Department. Authorities are investigating a possible motive.

item.title: Thousands Flock to Phoenix for Charlie Kirk’s Memorial Service
item.description: On Saturday a steady stream of people, many who had traveled from other cities, made a pilgrimage to Kirk’s Turning Point USA office and the mortuary ...

item.title: Trump's new $100K fee on H-1B visas will hurt the tech companies trying to woo him
item.description: More than half a million high-skilled U.S. workers are in the country through the H-1B program, which is heavily used by the big tech companies trying...

item.title: California bans masks meant to hide law enforcement officers' identities

item.title: Taylor Swift upcoming 'The Life of a Showgirl' to hit movie theatres

item.title: Cyberattack Causes Delays at Heathrow and Other Airports in Europe
item.description: A disruption to check-in and boarding systems had snarled departures through Saturday at airports in Berlin, Brussels, Dublin and London.

item.title: A Calm Before the Beer Taps Open at Oktoberfest
item.description: Until the taps open at Oktoberfest, it’s a nonalcoholic mix of card games, soft drinks and waiting.

item.title: Justice Alito, in Rome, Says Religious Liberty Is Under Siege
item.description: Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr., a conservative Catholic, has visited Rome for decades, often teaching or participating in academic conferences.
